title: Divided government
stimulusHtml:
Explanations must include more than simply a definition of the political factor

Explanation must include how or why the factor makes it difficult to enact policy Example must be explicitly linked to the political factor

Hypothetical examples are acceptable if the concepts are correctly exemplified

2 points: Divided government: (must include reference to party)

Explanation (1 point) (How/why difficult to enact)

  • President/Congress controlled by different parties

  • Chambers of Congress controlled by different parties

Example ( 1 point)
descriptions: Score of zero (0) for attempted answer that earns no points

The student response earned one of the following points:

1 point for an explanation (How/why difficult to enact)

  • President/Congress controlled by different parties

  • Chambers of Congress controlled by different parties

1 point for an example

1 point for an explanation (How/why difficult to enact)

  • Chambers of Congress controlled by different parties

title: Weak party discipline
stimulusHtml:
Explanations must include more than simply a definition of the political factor

Explanation must include how or why the factor makes it difficult to enact policy Example must be explicitly linked to the political factor

Hypothetical examples are acceptable if the concepts are correctly exemplified

2 points: Weak party discipline:

Explanation (1 point) (How/why difficult to enact)

  • Crossover voting

  • Diminished party ties

  • Difficulty predicting party support

  • Leadership has a more difficult time getting the votes

  • Individual members of Congress can defect without serious consequences

Example ( I point)
descriptions: Score of zero (0) for attempted answer that earns no points

title: Growth in mumber of interes groups and PACs
stimulusHtml:
Explanations must include more than simply a definition of the political factor

Explanation must include how or why the factor makes it difficult to enact policy Example must be explicitly linked to the political factor

Hypothetical examples are acceptable if the concepts are correctly exemplified

2 points: Growth in number of interest groups and PACs

Explanation (1 point) (How/why difficult to enact)

  • Competing interests

  • Interest groups can oppose policy initiatives.

  • Interest groups are "veto groups"

Example (1 point)
